Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: judith_p16
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here in October 2011 and enjoyed our stay!The hotel is centrally located, nearby shopping and in a safe area...also in front of the Angel de La independencia.. my room had an amazing view of the Angel.. I enjoyed staying at this hotel and the staff is also very good, in particular David who was friendly and helpful.. the only complaint about my room was that the bathroom door wouldn't close and it was difficult to open (it was one of those sliding doors)... the hotel is a little bit older but it is really nice...I would definitely stay at the Sheraton again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, with the repect one deserves.”
Reviews.Author: kenhecra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to the U.S. Embassy and facing the Angel de Independencia. The hotel is a bit older, but is kept up nicely. Upon arrival, the staff greets and properly attends to your every need. Aaron and Daniel at the front desk were very knowledgeable and respectful. This was my first time in Mexico City. The hotels location is 20 minutes walking distance from Bosque de Chapultepec and 25 minutes walking distance from Palacio Bellas Artes. The zone is safe and popular throughout the day and night. Two blocks around the hotel, you will find Cafe's, restaurants and bars. All of which are nice and provide great service. My room was located on the 18th floor, King bed was comfy and room spacious. Cleanliness was never and issue. The only issue was with the A/C. Although the A/C worked, the room felt a bit humid, however the weather was humid during my stay. Early morning, I contacted the concierge for a tour of the pyramids. My request was fully complete with a great company. All in all, the hotel is in a great location, the staff was wonderful and the room was comfortable. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very tired”
Reviews.Author: segmd
Reviews.Content: It has a great location, friendly staff and the lobby is beautiful. Other than that I won.ld go elsewhere. My room was small with a positively awful view of really close ugly buildings! I couldn't leave the curtains open or everyone could look in. The sink was cracked and the entrance light didn't work and the room felt very dark. I couldn't get the air conditioner to really cool the room. Breakfast was excellent. There are so many other much nicer hotels in Mexico City and I would definitely go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Jorge O
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a great place to rest in Mexico City in front of one of the must important places throughout Mexico country, the area is clear, beautiful, everything is near, the room is very comfortable. Please if you get rest in this hotel, Efrain is one of the best employees that I'm glad to deal, He has a very nice attitude, knows the places around the downtown, and He can help you in anything you need in a kindly way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - thats all”
Reviews.Author: Salsd1981
Reviews.Content: Pro - Location Con- paper thin walls You can hear the neighbors going to the bathroom !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Location”
Reviews.Author: Joe c
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Heart of Mexico City & in a ideal location all in walking distance. Be sure to check out Zona Rosa. Lots of night life there. The hotel room rate is very good too

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasBob_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adjacent to the US embassy and next to the famous Angel of Liberty monument. The area is clean and safe, many of the airline crews stay here. Prices are good considering the location. Sanborns deptartment store is next door and has a decent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK ....”
Reviews.Author: Galtraveller3
Reviews.Content: Booked for a business trip for 4 nights. To be honest not the quality I've experienced at other Sheratons, although the bed is as usual extremely comfy. Furnishings are definitely a little shabby, but bathroom is very clean (with poor shower which definitely needs attention). Extremely loud - and inefficient - AC which meant I opened the window and put up with the noisy fans from adjacent buildings and road. Not sure why the hotel thinks anyone would want a thick duvet and thick bed cover when the outside temperature is 28oC!! Was upgraded to the executive floor which was good for breakfast. In the evening ONE free local alcoholic drink was offered with snacks. However, in order to manage to eat something you have to be sure you beat the US contingency or there's nothing left; having piled their plates high on many occasions they had the cheek to comment that the food disappears quickly and you need to get there early to enjoy! Being a meek European doesn't do here - or you'll miss out. Why oh why do hotels charge such exhorbitant rates for net access?! Surely they can let us have this at the rate they charge! Would I recommend this hotel? To be honest, not really for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap SPG hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yiorgos E
Reviews.Content: tho the Zona Rosa dont have a good reputation , overall is not that bad . its really safe to go for a walk at night , good restaurants on the area behind the hotel and even Zona Rosa is not bad

Reviews.Title: “Good for business... a bit pricey for tourism”
Reviews.Author: cuatez
Reviews.Content: I travelleed in December 2011 to Mexico City with some friends. We went here because we could use a corporate discount and even though I am Mexican, my friends are not, so we figured an American-style hotel situated right next to the US Embassy would be a safe bet. In terms of security, which was a concern for my American friends, it's a completely safe location and, like I said, the US Embassy is right next door, so (depending on your point of view) it's pretty well guarded and convenient in case of any emergency. The location in general is excellent. It's right on the Paseo de la Reforma, the main avenue in Mexico City and it's right smack in front of the Angel de Independencia statue. The Turibus bus tour ha a stop right across the street, so that's convenient as well (although doesn't stop all that regularly). We actually walked to the Zocalo from the hotel and it took us about 20-25min. It's right in front of la Zona Rosa, with cute restaurants and bars (and gay bars if you are so inclined). But I really recommend La Condesa which is also really close, the bars and restaurants were fantastic for a real Mexican experience. In terms of taxis, the hotel usually gaveus town cars which were easily 2 or 3 times more expensive than regular taxis, so buyer beware. I really recommend getting the number of a local taxi station and just calling them. It's not recommended to just hail a taxi on the street in Mexico City. In terms of the hotel, yes it does look a little old, but that wasn't too much trouble. I got a haircut and had a beer in the bar and both were ludicrously overpriced. You can get much cheaper harcuts and beer acriss Reforma in the Zora Rosa. But in general, I thuught the hotel was overpriced. It was our fault for getting a business hotel, but if I was paying that price in the US, I would be fine with it. But charging that amount (About $120 US dlls per night) is extorionate in Mexico. I fI return, I would stay at the NH in Zona Rosa or the Marriot nearby on Reforma. I didn't think the price was worth it as a tourist. This is not a complaint about the serice. The staff were very attentive and the concierge helped us get tickes to the Ballet Folklorico de Amalia Hernandez at Bellas Artes (a must!).

Reviews.Title: “Central City Location for Business”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: I had a tower room that was small, but well-furnished and equipped. This is not a new hotel, but has been updated to include internet, a good workspace and comfortable easy chair. The bathroom was fine. The hotel's staff is very attentive and eager to please, providing a high level of service. It is located on the central plaza of Mexico City (Reforma) and there was a large demonstration there one afternoon. That detracted a bit from my experience. The tower lounge, though, was closed on Friday evening, when the posted scheduled indicated that it would be open. That was the only weak point in the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexPuente
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel located next to the most important monument in Mexico City, the Angel of Independence, so it has a great location. A little old but with good rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but the property is getting run down...”
Reviews.Author: DallasBenA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night, the location is excellent for business. I usually like to relax at the end of the day. During my stay this time, both, the sauna, and the steam were out of order, and although they knew it was out of order on Sunday, it still did not get fixed on Monday. I think perhaps preventive maintenance could help

Reviews.Title: “Leak in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: rubenmre
Reviews.Content: What a dump. The rate for the room was to expensive. The sink in the bathroom leaked all night. Finally hotel staff came and cleaned up the mess. I will never go back to that crappy hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Rajiv0917
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for business. Check in was pretty effortless, even though we moved in bulk. Getting out early in the day, staying whole day out in conference rooms and getting back only when it was time to sleep. Conference rooms are well managed, good and efficient staff. Food was good, even though I am a pure vegetarian I had couple of things to eat. Break fast is especially good. Location of the hotel is the best part. Right on road and a good sight. Staff speaks English and is friendly. I had difficulty with laundry, it was returned next day that too after two phone calls and the staff spoke no English. Lift is another horrible experience. I had a room in the back tower and only two of the four lifts worked. Even though there were service lifts near stairs, staff kept locked one of the main lifts for their use. Over all not a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “"Super location, Great service.. except from restaurant downstairs"”
Reviews.Author: Cesar L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good. I've stayed twice already and went above my expectations. Fast check-in, great rooms, and public areas. The rooms are quite confortable. I don't know about those reviews that say is just ok, because this Sheraton is far more excellent, and far better than other Sheratons I've stayed in the U.S with U.S standards. I guess they think in Mexico you pay minimun, and get super luxory, which is not the case. The location of the hotel is unbeatable, right across from the Angel of Independence Monument, on the main avenue of the city. There is a starbucks on the lower floor, very convenient. My only complaint is the argentinian lady at the restaurant downstairs by the starbucks, who is the host. She completely ignores people, and has the worst attitude. You have to talk to her, or she won't talk to you at all. When she finally attended to us, she rolled her eyes, told us to wait hastily, like she is being bothered by doing her job. She never came back. We ended up going to restaurant upstairs which is far better and with a great service.

Reviews.Title: “Decent option on Paseo de la Reforma”
Reviews.Author: NicolasandJacqueline
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled to Mexico City and needed a decent, relatively cheap room for a couple days. We used Priceline to book the hotel and ended up at the Sheraton MarÃ­a Isabel for $70/night - not a bad deal. The best asset of the hotel is it's location right on the Paseo de la Reforma, in front of the Ã�ngel de la Independencia, making it extremely convenient for tourism. There you can easily take the "Turibus", or walk to the Insurgentes metro station. We were visiting family for the New Year, so this wasn't really a requirement for us, but we prefered to target this area or Polanco with Priceline, since this is where most of the top-end hotels are. We had no complain with the service, which was good, and with the helpful staff. However, don't expect too much luxury: the hotel is quite old it would deserve some renovations. Our room was relatively small and a little dark. The furniture and decoration were a bit dull, probably from the early 90s at most -- a bit shabby, as other reviewers pointed out. Some more freebies would have been nice: the breakfast wasn't included (though I don't know if some rates do include it), wi-fi Internet was free only in the lobby, and the parking costed about $10 per day. All in all, we were quite pleased with our stay at the Sheraton MarÃ­a Isabel, given the very good rate we paid thanks to Priceline. We wouldn't mind staying there again, but we wouldn't pay more than we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Mexico city”
Reviews.Author: hotsyd22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights in December 2011. We picked this hotel based on the price and location - it is right on the edge of the "Zona Rosa". The hotel is in a very safe part of Mexico City - It is located next door to the US embassy and just across the main road to the tourist restaurant and bar strip in the Zona Rosa. There is police and security everywhere which meant we felt very safe walking around the area at night. This was good given the variety of restaurants to choose from nearby. There is also a Starbucks at the bottom of the hotel. The hotel is a bit older but it is clean and we found it more than adequate for the US$130/night we paid. The bed was great, the rooms spacious and the staff very helpful. Would very happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: Claire C
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the facilities one would expect of a 5 star hotel as well as professional and helpful staff but the hotel building and decor itself is becoming a bit shabby. Given the some of the super slick designer hotels the Sheraton is competing with, I would suggest shopping around and trying something different. The Hotel Nikko in Polanco is newer and nicer if you are after a hotel with typical facilities and, in my opinion is in a better location due to Polanco's good supply of restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great for meetings, tourism, and location”
Reviews.Author: jcmartinez777
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, the customer service is great, they are always asking if you are confortable, is located in an strategic point in mexico city, where everything is close.

Reviews.Title: “Big anonymous hotel”
Reviews.Author: 10En
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a decent hotel in were you can be anonymous, than the sheraton hotel and towers is your place. It is a clean room with really comfy bed and the usual standard interieur. Nothing special. A starbucks in the hotel, wich is nice for the morning coffee. But you ain't gonna see the the real mexico here! (I mean when you are in the hotel you can be anywhere in the world, they all look the same! But if that's what you like, go for it!) We got our room really cheap through priceline. The location is in zona rosa, wich is ok I guess. Mexico city is sooo big, and the things to see are spread, so it's a long trip to everywhere, no matter where you are staying. All in all ok stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice For Many Reasons”
Reviews.Author: David N
Reviews.Content: Spent Christmas at the Sheraton on one of the executive floors. Room was very nice, although not overly large, plenty of space with very nice bathroom and great view of the Reforma. The extra services were appreciated and the breakfast is more than adequate. Housekeeping was perfect. The staff couldn't be better and more friendly and helpful and almost every person spoke good English. I didn't feel like I was in a big hotel...more like home. Drinks in the lobby lounge are expensive and wifi isn't free (probably the only complaint I have), but Starbucks is on the premises with free internet. Taxi service is always available but much more expensive than grabbing one on the street which is much safer than it used to be. In ten years I've never had a problem. Location is just perfect and the area is very safe. Really, for the price (I got a special rate on Expedia) and such great service you can't do much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: expert18 Posted by a Choicehotels traveler
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is ideally located in Zona Rossa which is safe to hangout , plenty of good restaurants and shopping centers ( Plasa Rosa to the left of the hotel is the best one I found ) . The hotel staff is extremely nice , the breakfast is just amazing and keeps you full till dinner. As usual in these hotels their taxis cost the triple so just call a taxi station ( radio taxi ) or go to one ( there is one behind the HSBC tower ) .

Reviews.Title: “Totally fine hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Czesc
Reviews.Content: We booked this place on Priceline for $80USD per night. The hotel itself is quite dated, especially in the rooms. But the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, including the concierge. Gabriel in particular had a lot of great advice and recommendations for us.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: LBC3691
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel for my week stay in Mexico City. I really loved the location. It's proximity to Zona Rosa, Roma and Condesa was my deciding point. While this hotel definitely shows wear and tear (especially in rooms), the service was excellent and the view of El Angel was magnificent. Many excellent restaurants were just a short walk from the hotel, any direction. This was my first trip to Mexico City and I loved it. I felt very safe, met some wonderful and friendly people and there is so much to see that I am bringing a friend for my second trip in December. We decided to stay at this hotel since, in my opinion, its location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, reliable, comforeltable, but quite dated - still overall, a value for money hot”
Reviews.Author: vivekvikram
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maria Isabel Hotel for three nights recently, and the hotel was quite reasonably priced at around 150 dollars. The hotel is quite well located with an excellent view of the magnificent Independence Column. The rooms were comfortable, but the air conditioning was slightly poor, and the shower water temperature was uneven. The shower head too sprayed water all over the place, and it was a bit messy. The staff was very courteous and I really enjoyed food at both their restaurants Amici, and the Manhattan Deli. Apart from all these factors; the overriding impression of the hotel while one is there, or even after the stay, is that the Hotel is really really old.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old dame. well maintained. excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: KeysRobert
Reviews.Content: Right next to US Embassy. Safe. Walking distance to good Zona Rosa restaurants. Staying inside is also good, with Manhatan Deli & Starbuck. Love the rooftop pool views. Room are good size. Price is.. well Sheraton Prices.. Only problem is travling from airport is long and difficult despite being relatively close.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: VinnyGerard
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Very spacious room, but the shower temperature kept going from cold to very very hot evrey minute or so, hence the 4-star evaluation. Also worth to note that the gym was pretty good, and so was the wifi signal, even though it was a bit expensive. You also get 30min internet access at the lobby bar every day and 5 pages worth of printing. The pool is at the top floor, but it is very tiny. There is also a live music bar next to the lobby that seemed very good.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: iamcrispydammit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed twice recently at the Sheraton Maria Isabel while traveling around Mexico, and had a wonderful experience both times. The hotel is a little old and worn in some spots, but the beds are amazingly comfortable and always in tip-top shape, and the other furniture like tables and chairs always seem to be in fine condition as well. Where one notices the wear is more in places like the bathroom, where the tiles are occasionally cracked, or the chrome is worn off the faucets around the edges. None of this lessens the comfort we enjoy at this hotel; it just seems lived in. The thing that really shines about this hotel, as others have noted, is the professional, attentive and friendly service. When problems arise, we find them to be dealt with swiftly and without a fuss. On our most recent stay, we were upgraded (SPG benefit) to a Reforma-view room where the air conditioning just did not function well. The lowest temperature we could get in the morning/afternoon in the room was 75 degrees, and that was with the curtains closed to block out the sun. We called the front desk and a person from maintenance arrived in less than ten minutes to fix the problem. He tinkered with it and told us that if the temperature did not decrease in 20 minutes, we should call down to the front desk and notify them that it was still not working. Unfortunately, whatever he did failed to fix the problem, so we called down. The same man arrived and upon seeing that it wasn't getting any better, called to the front desk and had us moved to another room down the hall that he had already confirmed to have a well-functioning unit. He even helped us move all our things from the first room to the second. I was also impressed by an experience I had with room service, where the person I spoke to noticed that I had ordered items from the vegetarian section of the room service menu (a nice new addition since our last stay), and informed me that the tomato soup that I ordered (not specifically listed under the vegetarian menu) was normally prepared with chicken stock, but if I preferred, they would be happy to make it with plain water. It's a great waiter that looks out for you like that, but it's amazing with someone from room service does. Because of the service, we try to stay at the Sheraton Maria Isabel every time we're in Mexico City. At times, the rates are high (weekends are cheaper than weekdays, and certain holidays are also more expensive there), but we feel like it is our home away from home when we are in the Distrito Federal. Many of the employees (especially the bellhops) have stayed on for several years, and recognize us on sight and greet us by name when we arrive. The wonderful guest relations staff always sends us a welcome treat, such as a plate of fresh fruit, even though we are hardly high-rollers, just frequent guests. I'd recommend this hotel highly, although I'd suggest trying to plan your stay around the weekend when it is cheaper. The Reforma-view rooms are well worth the price difference if you can afford them, and club-level rooms are also a good value because they include a nice buffet breakfast in the exclusive club lounge. It may be that the club-lounge breakfast is not available 7 days a week, as is the case with many hotels. If paying extra for club level and hoping to make use of this amenity, be sure to double check. A note on SPG benefits: while the upgrades may not be spectacular, the entire front desk staff seems to be well-informed about SPG procedures and always gives room-type upgrades and late check out (4 pm) to SPG Gold/Platinum members unless they are especially busy. Standard SPG members will be placed on special SPG floors.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable and well located.”
Reviews.Author: archibalda
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location and although well past its glory days is still very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful, the bed extremely comfortable, the a/c worked beautifully all night (increasingly rare in other hotels!!!) and I absolutely loved having a Starbucks on the property. We enjoyed the abundant breakfast buffet in the Manhattan Deli and enjoyed having a Tequila and a sing along with the Mariachis in the Lobby Bar. My only gripe would be the over priced and pretentious Amici restaurant where there is no wine list and when we asked for something "bueno, bonito and barato" were presented with 5 bottles to choose from all in the $100 dollar range. Not my idea of cheap! The restaurant staff slowly warmed up a bit after initial snottiness but the food was not nearly good enough for the prices (one of our guests was a chef from a well known Italian restaurant and he was NOT impressed) and one wonders how hard is it to produce a good fresh pasta and salad with a friendly smile. No wonder the place was virtually empty.

Reviews.Title: “Wife's business trip”
Reviews.Author: yoto1
Reviews.Content: I travelled with wife for her business trip. Got a room through a friend, with a friendly rate. Property seems a bit old, but still ok condition. Breakfast is good, but rather expensive. Service is good, especially at concierge desk! thumps up for the team! Mariachi band at the bar was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: demandingdivatexas
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel on Priceline so got a great deal for the money. Great location, although rooms not large certainly adequate. Beds very comfortable and room very quiet. Staff always very helpful. Used internet at Starbucks to avoid paying the daily fee. All hotels should provide free internet in my opinion. Bath not large but certainly adequate. All very clean. Loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Cost-Benefit not so good”
Reviews.Author: choppan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed for a week on a business trip, the service personnel was great the overall hotel feels old, kinda like a horror movie. The food was OK, location excellent (in front of the Freedom Hotel in La Reforma Avenue), but I've felt that the overall price was too high. The internet service was very disappointing..

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired, lacking”
Reviews.Author: tylerat
Reviews.Content: An example of a hotel on the downside and the management milking it. As a Platinum member I was "upgraded" from a corner suite which I paid for, to a "suite" which was a large room, not two rooms but a large room. Where was the upgrade? My arrival gift was sent two hours after requested time and only after a call asking for it. Bathroom dated, tub/shower was combined and was one of those refits that just are placed in over old base. When you walk in shoer the floor rises and sinks with every step. No hair dryer in room (huh?). Called and said i needed one fast. Thirty minutes later the maid came with one as I was leaving (for good). A once very nice hotel, once one of the best in Mexico City, is now a sad, very sad example of neglect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel everything I wanted”
Reviews.Author: MaxxyHampshire
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this hotel room clean comfortable good short well equipped service friendly and everyone spoke English to me. Concierge great. I walked to central historic area but hop on and off turibus stops accords road from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Safe and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JackandMaddie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sheraton numerous times on business. I always feel very safe and comfortable staying here. It is just a short block away from the Embassy. There is a Starbucks located downstairs as well as numerous bars and restaurants. The hotel staff is attentive and helpful. The rooms are spacious enough with great views of El Angel on Paseo de la Reforma. The bathrooms are decent as well as the beds. They always provide me with plenty of bottled water as well as fresh fruit in the evenings. Located within walking distance is a shopping mall, movie theater, as well as numerous restaurants, bars and shops. I think this hotel is in a great location and walking around nearby I have always felt safe and comfortable. I would also recommend this hotel to anyone doing business nearby at the Embassy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: renbabe
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a very nice, clean property which is well maintained and well positioned. What really stands out for me is the service, without exception every single member of the Sheraton team was warm, welcoming, attentive and genuinely caring. I was sad to leave and would go back again tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: imerk
Reviews.Content: Located walking distance to the U.S. Embassy, this hotel is safely situated for concerned travelers. Somewhat pricey, but I think worth it. The facility has a nice lobby bar, a few excellent restraunts and a club with live music nightly. The beds are excellent; very comfortable. A few english speaking television stations. They charge about $15 for high speed Internet access (pretty slow, to be honest) but have free access in kiosks at the lobby bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Unsure at first but exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: I have memories of staying here in the past and not having a particularly fond opinion of the Maria Isabella however on this occassion I have happily changed my opinion. Upon arrival I noticed little had changed in the lobby. Although large it is rather dull, uninviting and with low ceilings. Its proximity to the US Embassy (next door) was not particularly reassuring from a security perspective and the presence of highly armed police in the area also made me wonder but then Ineeded to remind myself that this is Mexico City. I was in a room on the top floor of the tower furthest from the lobby (Floor 22). My room was rather dark and cluttered and the bathroom is just of a very unusual design where the toilet is annexed off without a door and the bath is oddly placed with only a small gap to climb into it making it very colostophic. Also the light directly above the toilet was broken when I checked in however it was so late I decided not to report it until the next morning as I just really wanted to sleep. The next morning I attended the buffet breakfast and my goodness what a feast. Wonderful layout of fresh fruit, cold meats, juices, cereals, yoghurts, hot mexican dishes, bacons, sausages, eggs and an omlette counter. It was wonderful and a bargain also. When I returned to the room I found that it had already been made up despite not a sign of housekeeping anywhere, they seemed invisible the entire length of my 6 day stay and didnt make a noise but always had my room done quickly. I also noticed a little note in my bathroom apologising for the broken light assuring me that it had been fixed....ID FORGOTTEN TO REPORT IT! So very VERY impressed by this! The TV was flatscreen and contained a fair number of english language news, movie and general channels. I found all the staff I encountered to be extremely friendly and chatty. One porter particularly eagre to learn some irish phrases from me. The gym was particularly impressive with a good range of top of the range Life Fitness equipment although I do think the temperature could have been a bit cooler. Also the location is of note, despite my initial concerns about security in the area I found Zona Rosa to be a lively and safe place to walk with numerous wonderful restaurants within walking distance and of course the Silver Market which I enjoyed. There is also a Starbucks just off the lobby which was hand it you wanted a coffee and to go online for free. My only serious gripes with this hotel was the room service. I had ordered the Nachos and expecting a typical plate piles high with nachos and all that comes with it (and like I have similarly had in other Sheratons) I was disappointed to receive a meagre plate of just 17 small nacho chips with a little bit of cheese and guacamole added! All for the handsome price of almost Â£15!!! It was one of the smallest yet most expensive meals I had in Mexico and I felt very short changed, especially in the home of the Nacho. Also the wait for the lifts was almost excrutiating. With a bank of 3 lifts only 2 at best were working. I was on the top floor so was always left waiting. On one day only one lift was working, I waited 15 minutes for it to arrive at floor 22 and then it stopped at almost every level on the way down even though after about 7 stops it was full. It took me a total of 25 minutes to get from my room to the lobby! When 2 lifts worked the average was 5 minutes which is still totally unacceptable. But apart from those two negatives I still had a wonderful stay. The staff were exceptional and although the rooms could do with an overhaul (especially the bathrooms) it was an excellent Sheraton experience! Well done Mexico City!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel; excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Spitfires135
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton MarÃ­a Isabel is a very nice hotel, better than several other Sheratons where I've stayed. The staff is extremely courteous and very professional. They will go out of their way to make you happy. They are also fluent in English. From the airport its a 20 min taxi ride for abt 180 pesos ($14). The hotel is next to the US Embassy and is near several good restaurants. It is also conveniently located near shopping. The down side is that it's also near the "red zone" which is a bit risquÃ©. One other negative-- the food at the Lobby Bar is mediocre at best. Overall, I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A week in the Tower”
Reviews.Author: Multi-Plug
Reviews.Content: Business trip to Mexico City - August 2011. Quite like this hotel and have stayed on previous occasions. It's always busy with plenty going on, has good facilities and the staff are friendly and efficient. Some of the rooms are a little tired but overall they're clean and comfortable. On arrival to my room in the Tower, I had to change it immediately as I hate those interconnecting room doors. This was done without problem. The bed and pillows were super-comfy and I enjoyed a good sleep every night. Internet works really well although charges are unfairly expensive, especially when other local hotels offer it for free. Breakfast buffet was excellent although not included in my package so I wasn't a regular visitor. Room service was quick and food was excellent. Gym was fairly small and there were a few power outtages which proved interesting: expecially on one occasion when I was on the treadmill! Hotel taxis are always available, safe to use but very expensive. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visitor - mostly good service”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior50
Reviews.Content: The reception of guests is very good 90% of the time (I am here about 8 times a year). The upgraded rooms are good, I especially like the bottled water for free use of guests. Occasionally, I have had a bad air conditioner or less than clean room. But the vast majority of the time, I like this hotel and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: yeungman
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night before we left for the airport at 5:30 am the next day. We checked-in at 7 pm and were assigned our 3 King rooms (upper floor) right away. The rooms are tired looking but still comfortable. We used the business center (free for 30 minutes for guests) to check emails. We walked outside to take pictures of the Independence monument. Next to the hotel is a store which also has a restaurant and a bakery. The baked goods are reduced to 50% off at 9:00 PM. We bought some and had them with coffee in our rooms before we met our driver (private transfer) at 5:30 am.

Reviews.Title: “A little tired for a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: PHXroadwarrior
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here and the hotel is definitely a little rough around the edges by Sheraton standards, but fairly typical based on many travels to Mexico. The rooms need an overhaul and show lots of wear and tear in the furniture especially. But my room was decent sized, had a nice bathroom, flat screen tv and the bedding was fresh and comfortable. I don't feel the property is up to the standards I've seen lately at any US Sheratons but is still quite decent and very centrally located. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, fabulous upgrade, great service”
Reviews.Author: volkswankin
Reviews.Content: I must say the service at the Sheraton is top notch. The front desk was very friendly and immediately recognized my SPG Platinum status. Without asking, he upgraded us to a superb corner suite with a view of the Angel of Independence. As many have stated the rooms are a bit worn, but the suite was comfortable and I appreciated the 2 bathrooms. We asked for a bottle of wine for our Plat amenity and they delivered it in less than 2 mins! We checked in late around 10:30 pm so we decided to just grab a few drinks in the Jorongo, the hotel lounge. We were shocked that they had bands, mariachi's and caribbean jazz playing. The cover charge is 160 pesos, but its waived for hotel guests. The drinks prices are steep, but the service was very good and our server promptly brought us a replacement drink after a drunk man kicked our table and spilled our drinks. Finally, the club lounge was fantastic. Breakfast was a huge spread of fruits, breads, eggs, bacon, and even tamales and scrambled egg whites. I was most impressed by how fresh the fruit was. At about $100/nt this hotel is a steal, especially for Plats.

Reviews.Title: “The service at the hotel was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Alex b
Reviews.Content: The people at this hotel went above and beyound to make sure my stay was a memorable one. The guest services and gym personnel did not fall behind either. They made sure that all of the services requested were handled in a perfessional and expidiate manner.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: IRISHDRAFT
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the good....the hotel is in a convenient location, has various facilities & nice places to eat nearby plus a starbucks next door, but it fell short of what I expect of a large high end international chain hotel. When we arrived about half of the several rooms booked were not ready, the rooms themselves are just ok, the best aspect was the bed was comfortable, but a 4'6" bed in a double room of a big chain hotel? the hotel concierge were pretty hopeless at recommendations of places to eat nearby & very much discouraged us from going anywhere not using one of their drivers. The pool area is tired & not that clean. Vedict.....probably OK if your company is paying for it on a business trip, for your own money, look a bit harder for something better.

Reviews.Title: “Started well, finished badly!”
Reviews.Author: AT-Yorks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business for 4 days and as a lone, female traveller had been advised it was in a safe neighbourhood (this was true, the hotel is in a great location). The staff at check-in and in the restaurants etc were friendly & helpful. The room was large, well equipped if in need of renovation! Everything functioned perfectly well, but the furniture & decoration are now slightly tired. My two reservations about recommending the hotel centre around cleanliness & charges. Upon arriving after a very long flight I was unimpressed to see two of the pillow cases on my bed had clearly not been changed. The most annoying thing about my stay however was the service (and attitude) I received when I checked out... I had organised a late checkout (3hrs after the 1pm check out) and was told this incurred a charge of $50 USD. I actually didn't need this in the end, but was told it had been charged, could not be refunded there & then - and also couldn't be deducted from my overall bill! I can write a letter to try and claim the money back... This is pretty bad service already, not helped by the receptionist's extremely dismissive attitude! I was a bit taken aback by her attitude actually as everybody else had been so helpful! Overall, a decent hotel with ok rooms which could have been cleaner. Advice to future guests would be to watch the charges as you'll have trouble getting legitimate refunds!!

Reviews.Title: “Service first and business perks”
Reviews.Author: ThereBeBears
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maria Isabel definitely puts service first. Regardless of the room you are in, they make it a point to make you comfortable. While I needed the practice with my Spanish, almost all of the staff has varying degrees of English (or some other language). While the pool (as reviewed earlier) is not the largest (and does leave a slight copper taste in your mouth) it is quite adequate as the weather here is not exactly balmy. The gym is a decent size with plenty of treadmills, weights, and elliptical trainers. The beds are super comfortable with soft sheets. The rooms are exceptionally clean and the staff does an amazing job. For those business travelers staying in the towers section, the breakfast offered is quite magnificent and who can beat coffee, juice (freshly squeezed), or tea brought to your room every morning? I judge a hotel on their shower pressure. This place has it in spades. It's not too much that you feel like you are getting pelted by a pressure washer, but it is powerful enough to feel like a massage.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a luxury hotel in Mexico City that lives up to it's name.”
Reviews.Author: los_companeros
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at two other 'luxury' hotels in the same area. No comparison! The Sheraton has service, restaurants, and quality accomodations...not to overlook a Starbucks adjacent to the lobby! Easy entry via their underground garage and an ATM that is not hidden behind locked doors! Definitely where we will stay when in Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “5* service”
Reviews.Author: keruin
Reviews.Content: Rafael at the front desk made my stay really pleasant and homey. After a hiccup in a previous visit, he made sure I was treated very well. He always remembered my name and preferences. I really think he's terrific at his job, and among others I saw, he is not alone. The fitness room is also excellent - everything you need and more, and plenty of it. I'd agree that the rooms are a bit tired, and the bikes for rent on Ciclo Via (Sundays) are a bit... difficult to ride. The other thing I'm not as crazy about is the food. But in Mexico City, who's going to stay in the hotel to eat anyway? There are so many options. Overall, the service makes the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service.”
Reviews.Author: DallasBenA
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff is not the friendlier, however the housekeeping And gym personnel are awesome. Be careful with additional charges and check your bill careful. Very expensive calls, water, etc. There are lots of 7/11 and other small places to go and get what you need. Make sure and ask for a room with a minibar, at least will get you fridge to keep your water and or drinks cold.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to everything”
Reviews.Author: ImATravelinFool
Reviews.Content: Safe and next to the US Embassy for those with business there and within walking distance to safe areas to shop and eat, this is a good hotel. As a VIP in the points program, I received a special room on a special floor with access to special restaurants for breakfast and drinks/happy hour apps in the evening. That combined with other special VIP services like butler and laundry service really made this a home away from home for an extended stay of 3 months for me which ended early last Fall. You really can't go wrong here with the in house restaurants and bars and the adjoining Starbucks and a block or two any direction for other food and shopping. I would easily stay here again during my next trip. The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. Enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff but BORING, old hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewW2
Reviews.Content: This was a three night stay for a wedding and I picked the Sheraton for its positive reviews, good location and good price at $95USD. Iâ€™m glad I didnâ€™t pay more. The hotel was good but seeing the more personable, smaller hotels of my friends, I regretted staying at the Sheraton. Seeing other hotels reminded me at how impersonal, large and generic these big hotels are. The staff really did their best but when youâ€™re in a city for a short period as a tourist, the experience can be so much more when youâ€™re staying somewhere more personable. Check-in was taking forever and a member of staff eventually escorted me to the Platinum level guest area which is a nice room off of the main lobby. A member of staff graciously checked me and I was whisked to my room. I was hoping for a room upgrade or at least a nice one but it was a throwback to the 1990â€™s â€“ browns, old furniture, dark, chipped bathroom furnishings and boring. There was a large gap between the door and floor and being close to the elevator, you could hear everything. The doors slammed and you could hear them in the middle of the night. Didnâ€™t use any of the other facilities in the hotel and didnâ€™t have breakfast. There is a Starbucks in the lobby which was nice. The hotel is located very close to some embassies and generally considered to be quite safe. There are also plenty of western bank machines and immediately across from a large HSBC office. Behind the hotel are a variety of nice street stalls and on the other side is the Zona Rosa, a vibrant gay and going out area. Taxi from Mexico City airport is 152 pesos one way, pre paid which was nice and secure from the airport. The hotel offers a car service for 150 pesos which are immediately available and secure. The concierge described the cars as just 30% more than the radio taxis. The cars were convenient and made trips easy. Not a lot to say about this hotel. At $95, it was OK, happy I didnâ€™t pay more. Other than the old rooms, the hotel didnâ€™t do anything wrong, it canâ€™t help what it is. In all cases, Iâ€™d advise going for a smaller hotel in the nicer more residential areas which have more character. Special thanks to Ricardo at front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Gym renewed reequiped”
Reviews.Author: MarioMtzB
Reviews.Content: Here at Sheraton Maria Isabel, Mexico City we can found new equipment for this Gym, I do not know since when but in march when I was there las time, it was Ok but now there ir new equipment. Even tough at the room the WC Door was broken everithing else was ok

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Highzone
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel with two great restaurants with excellent food and service! The location is next to the US Embassy so very safe with buses right in front of the hotel and a few minutes walk to the subway. It is very near Zona Rosa which has nice restaurants. It is near a church, too. I enjoyed using the gym as it has a wonderful steam room. I'll surely stay there again when I visit Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, view, location and many service extras”
Reviews.Author: Hons_Travel
Reviews.Content: Due to my SPG Platinum Preferred Status, we were upgraded to a spacious corner suite with an impressive view on the famous Angel of Independence. True, this hotel needs some kind of renovation/facelift but we really felt at home there. Friendly staff, lots of service extras at check-in, such as free ironing of 3 pieces, wake-up coffee, breakfast in room. Plus, a great club lounge with a good variety of breads. Located in the Paseo de la Reforma there are also lots of restaurants nearby, eg we enjoyed the Argentinean restaurant Quebracho at Rio Lerma. Their hotel bar plays live Mexican folklore music, but is targeted more to the older generation. Afterwards we stayed another 2 days at the more expensive and newer St Regis (which is not even 5 Minutes car drive away), but interestingly both agreed that Sheraton experience was better.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money but tired”
Reviews.Author: statestreet75
Reviews.Content: My third stay at this sheraton, principally because its within walking distance to the office. Room quality vary wildly, my first stay was a large pleasant room overlooking Paseo Reforma, the second a tiny room overlooking some roof expanse (at the same price), the third close to the first. Nice breakfast on the second floor with something for everybody. While the main bar is grim, the restaurant/bar within the hotel with live music is always a lot of fun. Rooms are tired with lots of broken tiles in the bathroom and faucets and such date back certainly 20 years. If convenience and proximity matters then its OK though the new JW Marriott (not tried) across the street might be a better bet. You get 30 minutes free wi-fi in the bar area (whoopee!) Starbucks in the complex which is nice if you don't want to go out.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Timon88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Mexican Bicentenario celebration--interesting, since one of the nerve centers of the celebration was just outside the hotel. Near some good restaurants and the Zona Rosa, it's a well-kept, comfortable hotel with all the amenities one expects.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and have booked again!”
Reviews.Author: adleedo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and had an amazing time! I had a corner suite that overlooked the Reforma which was beautiful. The rooms are not the most modern but they are comfortable and the staff make up for all shortcomings! They have a great gym facility with the hottest steamroom ever! Great after a long day of sightseeing! A butler woke me up each morning with fresh coffee and a pastry. A nice rooftop pool! A great breakfast on a high floor with nice views! I had an amazing time and have booked another 7 nights this coming November. I cannot wait!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel if you can get a good price”
Reviews.Author: globewanderist
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Overpriced at rack rate but very good deal if you can get a price under $200. They charge extra for anything extra, including coffee in room. But the beds are very good and the place is first-rate. Bar is expensive. Good food choices down the street out the back door.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOMELY PLACE”
Reviews.Author: ssapre
Reviews.Content: It was a memorable experience as it was my first visit to Mexico city.First as they did not reserve a room with a king bed for me - as I am very tall- they upgraded me to a corner suite, with excellent and homely service of a butler!!! The food was delicious and the staff courteous. I know where I am going to stay when I will be in Mexico city next -- for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well, well below our expectations... AC broken during summer”
Reviews.Author: DarkArcanine
Reviews.Content: My experience was awful considering the amount of money you pay per night here... First night: We stayed at room 1950, during the afternoon everything was ok but at 10 pm we noticed the room was getting warmer and warmer... 3 hours and 2 technicians later they told me they couldn't do anything about the unbearable heat, I raised hell at the lobby and they changed our room to 1050... so far so good, the 2nd room was cool. Second night: At 1 am, the same problem very, very hot room. They send the same technician and he told us the same thing: nothing could be done. Again, I raised hell downstairs and they changed our rooms AGAIN to room 1237... at 2.30am. After that, room 1237 was ok but it was a very, very unpleasant experience for a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Bar, Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sevenseat
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel should make even the most nervous Americano rest easy. It is right next door to the US Embassy. The hotel is large, clean and safe. The rooms are fairly typical of this hotel class with comfortable beds, flat screen TVs and nicely tiled bathrooms. The bar is large, comfortable and has a good selection. The location on the Paseo de la Reforma means that it is very safe, and that there is plenty of shopping and dining within walking distance. This is good, because Mexico City is notorious for its horrible traffic. I only have two minor gripes about the hotel: You only get 30 minutes of free Internet a day, and that is in the bar, after that it is $20 a day. The breakfast is not included in the rate, and would be considered pricey even in the US, at 240 pesos.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: china_mellons
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable hotel in the Zona Rosa, next door to the US Embassy and very close to the UK and Japanese embassies. Excellent buffet breakfast including fresh fruit, meats and cheeses, cooked breakfast and even Japanese (rice, fish, furikake and pickles). Beds were comfortable and very much what you would expect from Sheraton. Sadly I found the bar overpriced, but there are plenty of bars, cantinas and convenience stores in the area that you can visit instead. Disappointed with the rooftop swimming pool - definitely isn't for swimming in as it's only about 4 metres long!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a renovation!”
Reviews.Author: brookline426
Reviews.Content: Only in Mexico is this a 4 star hotel. It needs a renovation. Starwood should be embarrassed that this major hotel next to the embassy is in the chain. Rooms and food both mediocre. Staff was quite nice however.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: redcushion
Reviews.Content: i travel heavily for my job so am kinda picky about my hotels.......they threw in a lot of extras like they upgraded me to a nicer room with a view of the independence monument, gave me internet for free, etc ,etc. francisco at the reception was exceptionally good....... the only bad thing is the annoying false ceiling at the lobby level......its very low!!! but the room was nice, gym was pretty good and service was excellent.........

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs new A/C system”
Reviews.Author: felliott1
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Sheraton. The coolest either of our rooms could be was 22 degrees C, it was mostly closer to 25. We complained and when they could not fix the a/c in our first room, we moved to another room, but with no improvement in the a/c. We had the maintenance people there so many times, we were on a first name basis with them and I felt like a big part of my trip was spent dealing with the a/c. Mexico City is too hot of a city to have this big of a hotel not have adequate air conditioning. The hotel offers little else than being part of Starwood. I would pay a little more and stay at the W.

Reviews.Title: “tired! needs to be renovated asap if it wants to keep up with the comp.!”
Reviews.Author: tronicmusic
Reviews.Content: if someone else is paying this hotel is ok. though the rooms are old, the bed is nice and satff is alright. but if you are paying for the room stay at a newer property in mexico city! the st. regis is amazing and worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for location. That's it.”
Reviews.Author: Mexic0TravelerDallas
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times. something happens every time. A horrible, dirty room one day. No internet the other. flooding at 2 a.m. The hotel is old, clean but dingy, and the service is well meaning but not very good. If you want luxury and modern fixtures and cuisine, stay somewhere else.--for those SPG fans, the new Westin in Santa Fe is awesome, so isthe W in Polanco--. But the location of this hotel is superb! SUPERB!!!! Right in front of the angel of Independence on Reforma. Accessible to a lot of places. Even if the hotel is not the best, the location makes up for it. I will stay here IF i needed good location. If location is not important, go somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Time for Sheraton Investment and bring to 2000's”
Reviews.Author: Valueskr
Reviews.Content: Ok, the hotel location is the best thing this hotel has, the gym is just ok. Most of the staff are friendly but they are not top class as they do all they know, but they need more training. It is NOT their fault some things the hotel has are from 1960. If you are looking for vintage, this is your hotel. The hotel's deco ok and clean. But my biggest problem was with AC, granted Mexico city is not like Vegas in summer, and this was March not July. Sheraton need to SERIOUSLY remodel rooms, split the size of the hotel into having a 4points on one side and having the full Sheraton on the other side, so they can share fixed costs departments. And then remodel the whole thing if you don't want to get bad rep for the chain. This hotel facilities and service are not to Sheraton standards. After breaking a sweat in my room with full on AC I moved to Hilton Reforma which was totally looking like new and AC was only used at 70% no need to try 100% like I did at Sheraton Reforma. At Sheraton I ended up being moved 4 times to find a room where the AC worked...I can't believe they would allow their guests to go through this.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy. Mediocre service.”
Reviews.Author: RNRP
Reviews.Content: 3 nights and 3 problems: the fire alarm went off by mistake twice, followed by an apparently useless visit of staff to the room; and a maid entered the room without previous notice - by mistake - again, during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, not shabby chic”
Reviews.Author: NYinTransit
Reviews.Content: I ended a long visit to Mexico with two nights at the Sheraton. I chose the hotel as I was traveling alone and had an abundance of Starwood points I sought to use, and there were no rooms available at the W (which I would recommend). I have been many times to Mexico City, and usually stay in the Condesa or Polanco neighborhoods; this hotel is located on Reforma in the center, which I would recommend if you are planning mostly to visit sights (Zocalo, Chipultapec Park are both walking distance) and are less interested in being in a neighborhood with character. The service at the hotel was very good but the rooms not so much. While the decor was tasteful and the bed comfortable, the room was very frayed. The carpet was worn, there were stains on the wall, peeling wallpaper, picture literally falling out of its matte. Yet if you can overlook this, the hotel wasn't horrible. The location is central and accessible to most neighborhoods; there are many amenities nearby; the staff went out of its way to be helfpul. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel unless the price is very good or you are seeking to use points. Unfortunately, I have consistently been underwhelmed or disappointed by Sheraton; from my experiences staying in Sheratons in multiple countries, its standards are definitely below comparable chains like Hyatt, and far below those of more upscale chains like Le Meridian and Starwood's own W.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay in a typical sheraton at a good location”
Reviews.Author: GeraldSingapore
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for one night as part of my starwood properties' sampling in mexico city and find this to be in between St Regis (my favorite in the city) and the W (not my favorite) in terms of comfort and accessibility. the location is unbeatable. it is nearer to the main zona rosa area than the st regis and one will find plenty of dining option across the street along Genova street. the angel monument is also directly outside the hotel and if you get a room that looks out into it, you sure are gonna appreciate it! the rooms are typical sheraton: functional, and comfy. i truly believe that the sheraton sleeper beds are the best in the starwood group. in all honesty, the hotel is slightly miserly with the link@sheraton internet access and it caps users to daily allowance of 30 min. also, the rooms are showing wear and tear so do not expect something luxe and fancy. if you can get a good rate below 120 usd a night, then i highly rec. this place. if not, maybe you can explore other hotels cos i do not think this hotel justify any prices higher than 120 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Can housekeeping ever be unavailable in a 4 star hotel...YES!”
Reviews.Author: wannabRB
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru the hotel's call center coz the lady said she would be able to accommodate my request for an early checkin. I was arriving after a 9hr overnight flight from Sao Paulo, with little sleep and a gourmet vegetarian meal on aeromexico (but thats another story), 90m at the immigration counter and finally here on a Sunday morning at 7am only to learn that my room wasn't ready and that I'll have to hang out for 3 hours till 10am which is the early check in. The one i was allotted didn't include the gym facility even though I was told it did. They decided to upgrade me to one which did but I was forced to wait 3 hrs for that. They wouldn't provide me with a room just to freshen up nor let me leave my stuff in the allotted room, which wasn't occupied, while I waited for housekeeping to show up till a few hours later. So, I head to the gym, then bfast, then the biz centre but only 30m is the free time and finally I head to my room. But guess what, the ordeal continues. The Internet and the air-conditioning aren't working so I'm now spending time with the maintenance guys who take their own time to get here (it's a Sunday after all) and it's 6 hrs since I've arrived and I'm yet to settle down. Called the front desk who then got the Asst mgr and I was allotted another room on another floor which meant I had to repack to which I finally said no..coz by the time everything got set up my room was functional. What a start! Then, over the next few days that i stayed there, the router they installed in my room, because of a weak signal, didn't quite deliver. Continuously dropping my connection. The room's door and the wall around it are so thin that you will never know whose door is being opened or closed or knocked on. On the good side, the breakfast here is great and offers some good waffles and omlets. Decent spread but not much for a vegetarian. The gym is clean, well maintained and has some good equipment. Starbucks is located in the hotel so that helps. Walk around the hotel area a bit and u will find quite a few options to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Generally very relaxing but with a lack of consistency”
Reviews.Author: gwokypoodle
Reviews.Content: Having read the recent negative reviews of this hotel it was with some trepidation that I arrived for a two night stay. However, I was instantly favourably surprised by the lovely ambience of the huge ground floor with warm environment incorporating shops, reception area and the multiple tiered lobby bar with 30 minute free Internet access per day. I was very tired so I decided to treat myself to a nice meal on room service of shrimp cocktail, tenderloin steak and a glass of best red wine. I was told I was not allowed to have vegetables with my steak as it only came with chips so I had to order a separate portion of veg!!! When the order arrived I was presented with a small piece of steak with the rest of the plate covered with chips, no sauce - nothing - not even ketchup or mustard on the side and a plate of boring steamed vegetables with no flair whatsoever. The glass of red wine was completely rancid and had clearly come from a bottle that had been open for several days and went straight down the sink. I should have complained but was too tired. The meal itself to be fair, although lacking any flair was good quality. Next day I got up late and asked the reception staff where I could get a coffee and was told there was a Starbucks attached to the hotel. I then went back and asked them to tell me where was good for lunch and they were incredibly helpful making suggestions and esocrting me personally by name to the concierge who were extraordinarily helpful and courteous. I subsequently went out for lunch but again had a late light supper of taco soup and a club sandwich on room service which were excellent and also breakfast on room service the next day which was great and received a call asking me how it was. My room was fine but dated and the bed was comfortable but I thought ideally that a new mattress would be good as I felt I was sloping somewhat. There is a tiny outdoor swimming pool with some sun loungers but this is essentially a business hotel. Generally very good indeed but lets itself down insofar as you cannot guarantee a consistency of quality, efficiency or friendliness. Just when you think things are going great something will let you down so I say to the hotel 'improve your consistency of quality and service and you'll be among the best in Mexico City'.

Reviews.Title: “Average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wallsy10
Reviews.Content: A typical big name city hotel. Nothing special, nothing particularly bad! Does the job as a clean comfortabe place to sleep, but nothing more. Gym is good though!

Reviews.Title: “After 50 days less than mediocre and unsatisfied”
Reviews.Author: gusmonte
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very old, 1960s, and there are so many in the area that give so much more for less. Manangement at this hotel on three occassions did not come through on what was offered. The rooms have a dry swamp water smell, as if it had gone through a flood. I will never stay here again, I did not expect my trip to go on for so long, but I was not satisfied, I should have spent my 205 dollars a night elsewhere. With 755 rooms you are nobody and came to the conclusion based on the treatment I and others received my business is not needed. The business/computer center is worthless.

Reviews.Title: “Little, if any, reason to chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Biz_Traveller Latin America
Reviews.Content: I was obliged to use this hotel as part of a group staying here. The problem with the hotel is that it is well past its sell by date! It is so old and decrepit that the really need to knock the whole thing down and start again. It looks and feels like something from the 1970's, except with all character removed. There are so many great hotels in Mexico City that I see absolutely no reason to stay in this one, and won't in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location- avoid the personal car service”
Reviews.Author: ac1510
Reviews.Content: The location is great, it's within walking distance of Chapultepec park and right on Paseo de Reforma. If you are here on a the weekend, the street is closed to cars and you can walk for miles. The hotel itself is old and they will try and nickel and dime you for everything. There is a 7 eleven nearby where you can buy bottled water for 1/5th of the price of that in the room. There is a small pool on the top level but it's not very relaxing and there is limited shade. You can order drinks and food out by the pool. I was disappointed in the conceirge for this hotel. He seemed disinterested in helping me and didn't go out of his way to offer any advice etc. I went to the Teotihuacan pyramids and could have used a few pointers on how to get there by transit. Lastly, I had to move hotels for a business meeting and asked for a taxi. The doorman offered up their personal driver. Big mistake. The drive to the hotel was about 3 kilometers and it cost me almost $20 US equivalent. That was more that it cost me from the airport! This was a disappointing end to my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Experience”
Reviews.Author: PlinioFreire
Reviews.Content: My first time to stay at a Sheraton, and felt quite satisfied with the service and room. The concierge was quite knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Home away home”
Reviews.Author: caloliq
Reviews.Content: I believe the evenings in a comfortable room are essential for a great business trip. Sheraton in Mexico is one of the nicest place to have breakfast, that not only said by me but the numerous people there during the week and the weekends. At times of work, the business centre was very helpful and the employees ready to support any questions regarding instructions. The taxi service was also very important in our visit and they helped us find our fastest way out to get in time to our meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nickel and dimes customers.”
Reviews.Author: perryinvancouver
Reviews.Content: The location is good, but overall was quite dissapointing. As others said the rooms are slightly dated (wallpaper in the bathroom peeling, tap quite loose). The most annoying thing is that they seem pre-occupied with add on fees. Fitness center was included in my rate but they incorrectly charge me US$12 for using (then exchange it at a rate of US$1=MEX13.5, yes rates are subject to foreign exchange but the hotel is pathetic in the rip off rate it uses). I speak to the front desk and they say it will be corrected, but when I get home I see it was still charged. Lobby computers allowed 30mins per day but wasn't clear that it was 30mins straight, so after I used it for 10mins then went back in the evening the hotel wanted US$20 for one day access in the lobby. Lazy security at the front, they had 2 metal detectors with 5 workers standing around but made us line up to only go through 1 detector. Then during the weekend no need to clear security (waste of time all for show?!?!?!) A lot of potential here but overall was the poorest experience during my time spent in Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable but dated”
Reviews.Author: Uiop
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was superb, within walking distance of the histric centre and reasonably close to Condessa and Polanco. My initial room was overlooking Reforma but I had to change on the frst night due to noise outside. My next room was at the side overlooking the Angel and much quieter. The rooms were a good size, clean and comfortable although slightly worn and the decor was a bit dated. Light switches were not in logical locations and some nights I struggled to get the right combination to turn all the lights off. Staff were friendly and helpful at all times. The room had a plasma/LCD TV and a good range of English language channels. In room internet was a reasonable speed although rather expensive. Breakfast was fine with a good range and a juicing machine that enabled you to make your own freshly squeezed orange juice. Food in Deli was reasonable for lunch/dinner although there are plenty of other options within the surrounding blocks. The Starbucks was fine but service was very slow. As my stay was for a few weeks I was given a basket of fruit on my second night as part of the "Long Term Guest" recogniion programme but this was the only way my stay was recognised.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MELIXITALY
Reviews.Content: I've stayed many times in the Maria Isabel. You won't find a better location, the sight is really good - especially if you get a room towards the "Angel". Room quality may vary: sometimes you can get a newly refurbished room, sometimes you get a room in a great need of some renovation. Light switches are a trip into the history of electric industry, from archeaology to (almost) present days. TV Remote didn't work. I found the staff friendly and helpful, as usual. You may probably get a better deal with one of the newer hotels in Mexico, but I still prefer the Maria Isabel, after all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Honey333
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean, very helpful staff, good value, choice of restaurants/bars, great breakfast, very comfortable bed, free bike rental, good location., quiet. Cons: Quite an old hotel, so some decor is dated, not great toiletries in the room, pool does not open until 7am (which actually means 7.30am).

Reviews.Title: “The best location to stay in DF”
Reviews.Author: miamifire
Reviews.Content: I traveled here with my father for his birthday the first weekend in dec. We were given a room with a view of ''el angel''- breath taking. The entire area is always filled with police; in groups of 5 or 6 sometimes. I enjoyed this feeling of safety. The hotel was beautiful, sophisticated and a nice place to stay in on weekend nights with its bar that has different types of live music. The cover is steep though, about $15 USD and the drinks expensive, $6 for a cerveza. We ate breakfast at the sansborns next door almost every morning. Great huevos rancheros and huevos con chorizo. The staff was great and made every effort to please us. The bathroom I was told had no A/C and I was told this was normal. This turned out to be a nuisance because who likes to sit on a toilet and sweat? The room's A/C was weak and never got as cold as we wanted. This was attended to 3x and never resolved to my comfort. We were allowed to check in early (8am), a plus. Try the tacos across the street from sansborns. They were the very best in all of DF, we ate there daily. I believe it was called Jaliso taqueria or something similiar. We are originally from guadalajara so these tacos were just like the ones from home. Save some $ and drink the little bottled waters next to the sink. They are free and replaced daily. The larger bottles next to the mini bar are $5. We went to the XOXO (convinience) store around the corner and stocked up on bottled water for the weekend. This is way cheaper than the mini bar. Desent sized rooms and bath area. One day I could see my chapstick on the drinking glass, after turn down service, which led me to believe the maids did not replace the drinking glasses. A new set was sent no problem. A starbucks is downstairs but we drank chocolate at VIPS in zona rosa instead. This hotel is always bustling during the day with business like persons and the starbucks keeps a nice buzz to it. At night the open air bar in the hotel's lobby is vibrant with persons having drinks, sports on large screen TVs, complimentary hors d'oeuvres, a pianist. I strongly recommend this hotel and will stay here again when in DF.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: mebiner
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Maria Isabel for New Year's Eve and found everything perfect for a business-style hotel. The rooms were generically business standard, very comfortable with pillows both soft and firm to cater to anyone's preference. The windows were double-paned, which helped since the New Year's Eve concert was blasting at the Angel Monument until 3 am (I don't think that wouldn't happen any other night of the year). The staff all spoke English and were very friendly and efficient. We were allowed an early check-in (8 am) for no extra charge, although that is not something to expect as guaranteed. Zona Rosa is right across the boulevard and the stroll down Avenida Reforma was very pleasant to reach Chapultepec Park. The fitness room is small but good but the rooftop pool was unheated when we got there. A bit far from the metro (about 10 minute walk) but buses for 5 pesos (35 cents) go right down Reforma past the hotel to the city center or Chapultepec. All in all a very comfortable hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luisa023
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now and it is highly recommendable for anyone travelling for business. Accommodation is excellent and rooms have all comforts (including a desk with Internet connection for those business travelers). Room view of Mexico City is simply amazing. Location is excellent as it is right in front of the independence angel in the main centric area, just across â€œZona Rosaâ€�. Service is excellent and staff will go that extra mile to provide whatever you need. This hotel is also convention centre so it is mostly used for business purposes. Nice restaurants and bar in the lobby, also some small shops, bookstore and even a starbucks in the ground floor. Free internet facilities available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maria Isabel, Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: Cleon321
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and clean. It is also convenient to just about everything. Mexico City is a very large city, the staff was very helpful when it came to making site-seeing arrangements. The food is average. So things are very good, and others not so good. I never got sick from anything, so that is definitely a positive. This hotel and area of Mexico City definitely changed my opinion of Mexico City for the better. Also, the U.S. Embassy is right next door! Quebracho's is a excellent steakhouse a couple blocks away! It is safe to walk there at night. Sanborns, a good-sized department store is also right next door. The Wal-mart and Costco are kind of far from here.

Reviews.Title: “Old but I don't care”
Reviews.Author: JJM_traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel actually needs some remodeling (doors, lamps) but after all the room in general, location, service, and food are good enough to make me stay every time I travel to Mexico City. Great view to the "El Angel de la Independencia".

Reviews.Title: “For location, amenities, price and value - this is a top consideration in Mexico City.”
Reviews.Author: Pablo_Grabiel
Reviews.Content: From the first greeting to my check-out I was treated with the utmost friendlyness, courtesy and respect. My needs were attended to on a timely basis. The helpfulness of the staff - whether it is directions or some personal service is to notch. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to town,

Reviews.Title: “Despite the Good Points, No Hot Water, Spotty Internet Connection”
Reviews.Author: spettypi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five days while attending a medical conference. The water in the shower went from boiling hot to cold in a few second span each day i was there regardless of time of day. I complained to the front desk, nothing was done. This also happend to my co-worker. The first few days I was there the internet connection would go out for hours at a time - this seriously hurt my ability to do my job while there. The room also smelled like dirty socks. But in all fairness, I hear this is just a problem in Mexico City. The gym was also tiny and smelled like old sweat. If you do end up staying here the good points are: there is a business center on the top floor with a free full breakfast and snacks in the evening and an awesome view of the city. There is also a starbucks in the lobby, which was a lifesaver. The hotel restaurants were okay, really touristy, nothing authentic. The location was also pretty good. Safe neighborhood, well lit, doormen help you get a taxi, near museums, centro historico, shopping, etc. If you are staying in Mexico City make sure you research your location - the traffic is terrible and just catching a cab to go out to dinner isn't as easy as it may seem. This hotel also had a good looking tennis court that i didn't have time to try out Not the best hotel, but not the worst by far.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Hotel with Rude Managers”
Reviews.Author: RobbDallas
Reviews.Content: With a great location and fair experiences in the past, I stayed here over the Memorial Day weekend. The hotel looks dated and is in need of a face-lift. While checking in with a guest, the night manager insisted on my guest leaving his Colombian passport with the hotel. I (an American) did not have to physically leave my identification, but my Colombian guest was required to. I asked if a copy of the documentation could be made and he replied, "No, for security reasons he must leave his identification." Odd.
